goal_meta_national_link_text: Metadata on the presented time series
indicator_name: Mortality rate attributed to household and ambient air pollution
target_name: By 2030, substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination
un_designated_tier: Tier I
source_url_text_1: Determination of the health consequences due to fine dust pollution (only available in German)

data_start_values.value: Short-term exposure to particulate matter: mortality due to acute respiratory diseases (children < 5 years)
Long-term exposure to fine particulate matter: mortality due to cardiopulmonary diseases (adults > 30 years)
Long-term exposure to particulate matter: mortality due to lung cancer (adults > 30 years)

data_footnote: Number of premature deaths (Attributable deaths): Number of deaths that occurred before the statistically average life expectancy was reached. Cardiopulmonary: relating to the heart and lungs. Short-term exposure to particulate matter: mortality due to acute respiratory diseases (children < 5 years): Number <1.

A suitable data source has been identified. The corresponding time series are currently being processed to be included in this reporting platform.
